summary.para: Determines whether the app package is a default applicable package.

param.name: isDefaultApplicablePackage
param.para: True if the package is a default applicable package, False otherwise.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: A default applicable package is a package that contains the default MRT-qualified resources. For example, a default applicable package could be English language resources that should be installed by default if no other appropriate alternative language is available.
For more information on app resources, see App resources and the Resource Management System.

summary.para: Determines whether the app package is a non-qualified resource package.

param.name: isNonQualifiedResourcePackage
param.para: True if the package is a non-qualified resource package, False otherwise.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: A non-qualified resource package is a package that contains resources that are not qualified with any language, scale, or other qualifier. An example of this could be a package that contains all music files.
For more information on app resources, see App resources and the Resource Management System.

summary.para: Determines whether a package is stored inside an app bundle, or if it's a reference to a package.

param.name: isPackageReference
param.para: True if the package in the bundle is a reference to a package; False if the package in the bundle is stored inside the app bundle.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Provides a read-only object model for a <Package> element in a bundle package manifest.
